name: 穩定同位素地質學
comment: 中階以上課程，適合大三以上學生修習，以作為探究研究所之先修課程，同時也開放碩士班無此課程基礎之學生選修。
goals: Historical background, basic principles and characteristics of Stable Isotope.
Applications of Stable Isotope in the studies of environmental geochemistry and hydrology.
Applications of Stable Isotope in the studies of carbonate rocks.
Applications of Stable Isotope in the studies of paleoclimate, paleoceanography, archaeology, and global change.
syllabus:
Week Plan for this course is 16+2.  Flexible weeks is planned to be a field trip. Date for field trip will be determined in the class. 

This course introduces basic principles of stable isotopes and their applications in the studies of global change, environmental geochemistry, hydrology, carbonate rocks, archaeology, paleoclimate, and paleoceanography.

Week 1       Introduction of course ; Nature of isotope and historical background

Week 2       Nature of isotope and historical background; Mass spectrometer, notation, and standards

Week 3      Basic theory of isotope fractionation

Week 4      Nature distribution of stable isotopes

Week 5      18O/16O and 2H/1H isotopes

Week 6      Tracers of nature waters: 18O/16O and 2H/1H

Week 7      Oxygen isotope in sediments: oxygen isotope temperature and stratigraphy (I)

Week 8       Mid-term            

Week 9       Oxygen isotope in sediments: oxygen isotope temperature and stratigraphy (II)

Week 10    Carbon isotope(I)

Week 11    Carbon isotope (II)

Week 12    Carbon isotope (III)

Week 13    Nitrogen isotope

Week 14    Sulfur isotope

Week 15    Student presentation

Week 16    Final exam

Week17、18   Field Trip, TBA

grading.note: Homework and/or presentation of term paper

prerequisite: ◎Available for junior and senior year B.A. program students (Doctoral program courses excepted) and M.A. program students.
